title: Relates to prohibiting colleges from denying formerly incarcerated individuals admittance to college based solely on their incarceration
summary: Relates to prohibiting colleges from denying formerly incarcerated individuals admittance to college based solely on their incarceration.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2221

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. GIBSON -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Education

       AN  ACT  to amend the education law, in relation to prohibiting colleges
         from denying formerly incarcerated individuals admittance  to  college
         based solely on their incarceration

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new  section  6438
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S   6438.  COLLEGE  ADMITTANCE  FOR  PEOPLE  PREVIOUSLY  INCARCERATED.
    4  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW TO THE  CONTRARY,  NO  PERSON
    5  WHO  HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN INCARCERATED, SHALL BE DENIED ADMITTANCE TO ANY
    6  INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION, BASED SOLELY ON SUCH INCARCERATION.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of July  next  succeeding
    8  the date on which it shall have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01517-01-1
